Description: Head of a colossal sandstone statue of a ram, probably a criosphinx, with incised details.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Temple of Khons, For the attribution of this head to the sphinxes to the south of the temple of Khonsu, see Cabrol, Cahiers de Karnak X, 43 n. 42. They may originally have been in the temple of Mut and were moved to this location by Panedjem I (Cabrol 56-7).
Curator's comments: See 'Findspot' for further details of possible origin, See Fiechter, RdE 48 (1997) and Bierbrier in Fs James for more on the antiquities taken from the French Expedition.
Bibliographic references: Long 1846 / The Egyptian antiquities in the British Museum: monuments, obelisks, temples, sphinxes, sculpture, statues, paintings, pyramids, mummies, papyrus, and the Rosetta Stone (p. 217, fig. a; p. 216)
Porter and Moss 1972 / Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs, and Paintings 2: Theban Temples (p. 191)
Cabrol 2001 / Les voies processionnelles de Thèbes (pp. 244 - 245.)
Acquisition name: Donated by: George III, King of the United Kingdom
